thread.title: United star takes issue with new FIFA 17 rating
thread.title_full: United star takes issue with new FIFA 17 rating

title: United star takes issue with new FIFA 17 rating
text:
FIFA 17 Premier League player rating upgrades: Chelsea, Liverpool winners; Martial sore loser Staff writers, FOX SPORTS February 19, 2017 11:51am 
EA Sports have begun the rollout of their ‘Ratings Refresh’ where standout players’ FIFA 17 game ratings are changed based on their form in the 2016-17 season so far. 
To start with, over 60 Premier League players have had their ratings tinkered with permanently, and over the next 10 days players from all of the top leagues, including Serie A, La Liga, Ligue 1 and the Bundesliga, will have their ratings upgraded or downgraded. 
While it’s no surprise that five players from league leaders Chelsea - N’Golo Kante, Eden Hazard, Marcos Alonso, Victor Moses and Diego Costa - have enjoyed upgrades, six Liverpool players have also improved - Phil Coutinho, Joel Matip, Jordan Henderson, Roberto Firmino, Divock Origi and Adam Lallana. Over 60 @premierleague players have had their ratings updated! Next league on Sunday. Full list -> https://t.co/hXs6MGJM5e #RatingsRefresh pic.twitter.com/BBnLGQKlIS — EA SPORTS FIFA (@EASPORTSFIFA) February 17, 2017 
However, Leicester City centre-backs Robert Huth and Wes Morgan have seen their ratings drop after a string of disappointing results. 
Though, the player with the biggest issue concerning his rating seems to be Manchester United’s Anthony Martial. 
The 21-year-old Frenchman is known as one of the league’s fastest players, but after receiving a pace rating of 93 (up from 87), he questioned what it would take to push his rating up to 99. — Anthony Martial (@AnthonyMartial) February 18, 2017
